isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - ASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: UPPER AND LOWER MAIN COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

note.para: The upper and lower countershafts are each serviced in the same way.
Refer to Figure 165 to identify the components of the countershaft assembly for the transmission models.

figure.caption: Figure 165. Components Of The Upper and Lower Main Countershaft Assemblies

step1.para: Lubricate all the parts with new oil that is used in the transmission.
Design Level 1 Transmissions: install the roll pin in the hole in the groove for the key (Figure 166).

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition. If the tools are worn or damaged (mushroomed), pieces can break and cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Use a punch and a hammer to install the key in the groove. On Design Level 1 Transmissions, make sure the taper on the end of the key is installed toward the roll pin (Figure 166).

figure.caption: Figure 166. Make Sure Taper on End of Key is Toward Roll Pin

step1.para: Put the first or the second gear on a press so that the hub is toward the bottom of the press. Put the shaft in the gear. Make sure the slot in the gear is aligned with the key. Press the shaft until the first gear touches the gear on the countershaft ( Figure 167).

figure.caption: Figure 167. Put First or Second Gear on a Press

step1.para: Put the second or third gear on a press. Put the shaft in the gear. Make sure the slot in the gear is aligned with the key. Press the shaft until the hub of the second gear touches the hub of the first gear ( Figure 168).

figure.caption: Figure 168. Put Second or Third Gear on a Press

step1.para: Put the third or overdrive gear on a press so that the hub is away from the top of the press. Put the shaft in the gear. Make sure the slot in the gear is aligned with the key. Press the shaft until the hub of the third gear touches the hub of the second gear (Figure 169).

figure.caption: Figure 169. Put Third or Overdrive Gear on a Press

step1.para: Put the PTO gear on the press so that the chamfered side of the teeth is toward the top of the press. Put the shaft in the gear. Makes sure the slot in the gear is aligned with the key in the shaft. Press the PTO gear on the shaft until the PTO hub touches the hub of the third or overdrive gear.

Put the main drive gear on a press so that the large hub of the gear is toward the PTO gear. Put the shaft in the gear. Make sure the slot in the gear is aligned with the key in the shaft. Put a sleeve on top of the shaft. Press the shaft into the gear until the hub of the main drive gear touches the hub of the PTO gear (Figure 170).

figure.caption: Figure 170. Put Main Drive Gear on a Press

caution.para: Use the bearing inner race for installation. If pressure is applied to the bearing cage, the bearing will be damaged.

step1.para: Install front and rear countershaft bearing cones in one of the following ways:

step2.para: Use a sleeve or a bearing installation tool to install the cones. Make sure the bottom of the cone touches the shoulder on the shaft (Figure 171).

warning.para: Wear insulated gloves or similar protection to prevent possible burns when handling hot components.

step2.para: Heat the bearing cone to install the cone on the shaft. Make sure the bottom of the cone touches the shoulder on the shaft.
